documents.title: karen buckley 's killer alexander pacteau abandons appeal against his sentence
text: the man who killed irish student karen buckley has abandoned the appeal against his sentence .

alexander pacteau , 21 , was jailed for a minimum of 23 years after admitting bludgeoning the 24-year-old with a spanner and strangling her in his car after she had been on a night out with friends in glasgow .
he then attempted to dispose of ms buckley 's body in a vat of chemicals at a farm outside glasgow .
the appeal was due to be heard on friday , but a spokeswoman from the judiciary of scotland confirmed the case will no longer call .

documents.title: weather update - how low is it going to go ?
text: a mainly dry and clear night to come - and much colder than last night .
it remains breezy over the northern and western isles from the west , with a few showers in the far north and north west which will be wintry on the hills .
elsewhere it 's dry with light winds inland and a widespread frost .
temperatures for most will be around the freezing mark ; minus 3 or 4c in parts of the central highlands and inland aberdeenshire .
author: BBC Scotland Weather

documents.title: travelling celtic fans advised not to use metro when they visit istanbul for fenerbahce game
text: celtic fans have been advised not to use the metro system in istanbul when they visit turkey for next week 's europa league tie against fenerbahce .
the warning was issued by the foreign office after a pipe bomb on an overpass near istanbul 's bayrampasa metro station injured five people .
fenerbahce host celtic on 10 december , with the game kicking off at 18:00 gmt .
travelling supporters have also been told not to display celtic flags or scarves in public places .
author: BBC Sport Scotland

documents.title: man found with heroin inside his body is ordered to hand over crime cash
text: a dumfries man who was found with heroin concealed inside his body has been made the subject of a £ 31,818 confiscation order .
police found the drugs when they detained waheed anwar , 42 , for questioning in february 2013 .
he was subsequently found guilty of being involved in supplying heroin and sentenced to three years in prison .
the cash confiscation order was made at dumfries sheriff court after a full investigation of his financial history .
it was aimed at uncovering any income which he could not account for , whether or not it could be linked to the drugs find .

documents.title: scotland licence fee boost 'could benefit whole country '
text: more licence fee funding for bbc scotland could generate economic benefits for the country as a whole , the culture secretary has said .
fiona hyslop said the bbc could `` transform '' broadcasting in scotland by transferring budgets north of the border .
the bbc is currently holding consultations on its future .
speaking at an event in edinburgh , ms hyslop said the charter renewal process should be `` truly radical '' .

the culture secretary said transferring a greater proportion of licence fee funds to bbc scotland would allow independent decision-making and editorial choices and greater investment in local creative industries .

documents.title: man , 57 , charged over cat shooting after animal 's leg is amputated
text: a 57-year-old man has been charged in connection with the shooting in moray of a cat which had to have a leg amputated .
police scotland said the incident happened on 16 november .
a man from the glenallachie area has been charged and reported to the procurator fiscal .

documents.title: burger van owners overturn ban on locating near schools in north lanarkshire
text: burger van owners in north lanarkshire have overturned an exclusion zone which banned them from locating near schools .
about 30 businesses took the council to court after it refused to let them trade within 250 metres of schools .
the council said having the vans near schools ran counter to its promotion of healthier lifestyles for children .
at hamilton sheriff court , sheriff vincent smith ruled the council did not have the power to impose this condition on the licences of the street traders .

documents.title: judo stars louise and kimberley renicks concerned about rio funding
text: louise renicks is concerned that a lack of funding will shatter her sister kimberley 's dream of competing for britain 's judo team in the olym
kimberley renicks , 27 , is britain 's top-ranked player at -48kg but needs a strong run of results to leap almost 25 places into the world 's top 16 .
`` we budgeted for £ 20,000 for the full year .
we got £ 8,000 and that 's all spent , '' said louise of her fundraiser .
`` unfortunately , in judo there is only a small amount of funding . ''
the renicks sisters , from coatbridge , enjoyed high profiles during the 2014 commonwealth games in glasgow , winning the host country 's first gold medals .
however , the battle for funding , combined with recurring injuries , led 32-year-old louise to retire from competitive judo this summer .
author: Jane Lewis
BBC Sport Scotland

documents.title: cctv image of man linked to 'high-value ' robberies on trains
text: a cctv image of a man police want to speak to in connection with two high-value robberies on board trains has been released .
the incidents occurred on tuesday 20 october and wednesday 21 october at about 22:20 on the edinburgh to aberdeen service at stonehaven .
the man is described as being in his late 30s , slim build , clean-shaven and with short brown/greying hair .
he was wearing a dark jacket , denim trousers and was carrying a dark rucksack .
british transport police have appealed for witnesses .

documents.title: eight similar faults found by engineers working to repair damage on forth road bridgeupdate
text: engineers on the forth road bridge say they have found eight potential structural faults like the one which has caused travel chaos today .
contractors amey say they will continue to keep a close eye on them while working on a permanent solution .
traffic on the bridge will continue to be restricted to a single lane in each direction until at least the middle of the day on thursday .

he says there is no `` exit strategy '' and the house should reject the motion .

documents.title: greens concerned by appointment of new police chief with 'passing knowledge ' of scotland
text: the scottish greens have expressed `` concern '' at the appointment of phil gormley as chief constable of police scotland .
the party 's justice spokesman john finnie msp said he feared mr gormley would only have `` a passing knowledge of scotland , its police service and community expectations '' .
mr gormley , who will take over from sir stephen house , is the former deputy director of the national crime agency .
he said : `` this is not the appointment many , myself included , had hoped for .
this was an opportunity to address many of the concerns the public have about the single service .
that could have happened with the two serving officers who were shortlisted .
i remain to be convinced it can with someone who can only have passing knowledge of scotland , its police service and community expectations .
i suspect the new chief will say he needs a period to reflect , meaning the much-needed drive to enhance local community policing and its scrutiny is going to have to wait .
of course , we must congratulate the successful candidate and wish him well in his new post . ''

the shows children from around the world being welcomed to ms sturgeon 's official residence , bute house in edinburgh .
cards will feature the print and the original will be auctioned for charity .
the proceeds of the sale will be shared between four charities ; enable scotland , children 1st , books abroad and the scottish refugee council .

documents.title: driver of car which demolished a garden wall in lanarkshire is sought by police
text: police are attempting to trace the driver of a car which demolished a garden wall in north lanarkshire .

george forsyth , whose garden wall and fence was damaged , said he heard a loud bang just after 09:00. he said it was `` lucky '' the incident was not worse .
the road was closed in the aftermath of the crash but has since re-opened .

documents.title: traffic on forth road bridge will continue to be restricted until at least midday on thursdayupdate
text: traffic restrictions have been in place on the bridge since tuesday evening following the discovery of a defect to a steel component beneath the southbound carriageway during a routine inspection .

in a statement , amey said engineers and specialists were in the process of `` completing calculations with a view to implementing a temporary solution in the near future and a permanent repair at a future date . ''

amey engineer mark arndt added : a key structural component beneath the southbound carriageway has failed so it is important that we carry out all the necessary calculations before relaxing safety restrictions .
following the detailed inspection carried out this morning , we now have the information required to develop both short and long term solutions .
`` our team will be working through the night to design and check our plans and we aim to have these confirmed during the day tomorrow . ''

documents.title: police hunt man who punched woman in glasgow 's west end
text: police are hunting a man who attacked a 39-year-old woman in ashton lane last saturday .
officers said the woman had left a bar at about 00:10 and was standing watching a busker when the man approached and verbally abused her .
he then punched her , causing the woman to fall to the ground and break her wrist .
she later received reconstructive surgery at the city 's queen elizabeth 's university hospital .
the suspect was wearing a tartan or checked shirt and jeans and made off towards great george street .
police have appealed for witnesses .

documents.title: scottish government vows to take on bill to outlaw pavement parking
text: the scottish government has pledged to take over a member 's bill to make it an offence to park on pavements throughout scotland .
it follows disagreement over whether holyrood has the power to change the law to prevent parked cars causing a problem for guide-dog owners , wheelchair users and parents with pushchairs .
ministers are in talks with westminster to remove all doubt about the proposal 's legislative competence .
transport minister derek mackay told a holyrood committee that if the issue was not resolved before the scottish parliament dissolved for the election , the next government should reintroduce it .

documents.title: scottish police federation congratulates gormley and warns of 'extremely challenging and difficult job ' aheadupdate
text: in a statement , the scottish police federation said : there is no question that mr gormley faces an extremely challenging and difficult job and we wish him every success in his new role . ''
the organisation that speaks on behalf of officers , also said the financial climate in which mr gormley must operate had
they added : `` internally , he faces a workforce which has recently reported unprecedented high levels of dissatisfaction with the job and action needs to be taken to address that . ''
`` mr gormley 's entire policing career has been forged in england .
in the past we have expressed concerns that policing in scotland has had its unique identity diminished due to a lack of understanding of our own challenges and issues .
`` we have already met with mr gormley and are delighted that he has acknowledged his willingness to listen and learn . ''

documents.title: phil gormley says he has 'experience and insight ' to lead police scotlandupdate
text: police scotland 's new chief constable phil gormley says he has the skills needed to take on the challenge of leading police scotland .
the former deputy director of the national crime agency , will replace sir stephen house who formally stood down this week .

mr gormley is a former chief constable of norfolk constabulary , deputy chief constable of west midlands police and a commander of special operations at the metropolitan police , was responsible for firearms and aviation security as well as counter-terrorism .
he said :
i believe i have the skills , the experience and the insight required to lead the amazing workforce we have across police scotland .
i have a 30-year career in policing and law enforcement , the last 13 years as a chief officer leading organisations delivering for the public in a period of profound transformation for policing .

police scotland is on just such a journey and it will be my job to ensure our service strikes the right balance between local community approaches and the many challenges we face from organised criminals , cyber crime and extremism .

documents.title: winter hillwalking groups urged to carry sharing shelters in case their trip goes wrong
text: walkers travelling into the hills in winter as a group have been encouraged to take nylon shelter with them in case their trek goes wrong .
the mountaineering council of scotland has issued the advice as part of a safety message to walkers and climbers .
most of its advice is aimed at people new to tackling scotland 's hills and mountains in winter conditions .
it said a lightweight group shelter could prove essential if a walker was injured , or the weather deteriorated .

documents.title: nhs highland appoints senior liberal democrat councillor david alston as its new chairman
text: senior highland liberal democrat councillor david alston has been appointed nhs highland 's new chairman .
he will take over from garry coutts , who stands down as the health board 's chairman in march 2016 .
mr coutts has served in the post for the statutory maximum of three consecutive four-year terms .
the scottish government has re-advertised the vacancy in september .
the health board covers a large area , including the highlands , skye and parts of argyll .
its hospitals include raigmore in inverness , caithness general in wick and belford in fort william .

documents.title: carmichael defends 'legal ' lib dem decision to back uk goverment on syrian air strikes
text: former scottish secretary alistair carmichael has defended the liberal democrats ' decision to support air strikes in syria .
speaking ahead of today 's house of commons vote , mr carmichael said : `` decisions of this sort are never easy and this has been the most difficult one that i have ever known .
i certainly do not share david cameron 's reported view that those who oppose intervention are terrorist sympathisers '' .
`` this is an issue on which we have all had to come to our own conclusions and for many of us it has been an enormously difficult process .

`` i know no one , inside parliament or not , who has approached this from anything other than a position of good faith and i respect completely those who have reached a different conclusion from mine .
`` by comparison the decision to oppose war in iraq was simple by comparison - it was clearly illegal and it was difficult to identify what the british interest in intervention was .

`` recognising that some of the problems we are dealing with today have their roots in that disastrous misadventure , we should be quite clear about why this is a different conflict with different issues .
`` the intervention against isil/da'esh in iraq which we currently support is legal by virtue of the fact that we were invited to take part by the iraqi government .
the proposed extension of that to syria is legal as it has the mandate of a united nation security council resolution 2249 .
the legality of the proposal is therefore clear . ''

documents.title: bid to save crab meat factory which employs more than 80 staff in the borders 'has been in vain '
text: an mp has said efforts to save a crab meat factory which employs more than 80 staff in the scottish borders have proved to be in vain .
calum kerr said `` every effort to explore any avenue '' had been made to keep burgons of eyemouth open .
the company started consultation over plans to close the facility last month .
spokesman trevor bartlett said negotiations with potential buyers had been ongoing and would continue for as long as possible .

documents.title: phil gormley is appointed chief constable of police scotland
text: the deputy director of the national crime agency , phil gormley , has been appointed to run police scotland , bbc scotland understands .
the 53-year-old will take over from sir stephen house .
he was competing for the job alongside two senior police scotland bosses , iain livingstone and neil richardson .
mr gormley began his policing career at thames valley in 1985 , and before his appointment to the crime agency role he was chief constable of norfolk police .
the father-of-one has also worked for the metropolitan police and in 2005 he was responsible for the merger of special branch and the anti-terrorist branch to form the counter-terrorism command .
mr gormely , who will be given a salary of about £ 200,000 per year , will take over at police scotland in the wake of criticisms .

documents.title: woman from ayr jailed for trying to smuggle cocaine worth £ 1m in toiletries
text: myrtle mccreath , 53 , was arrested at glasgow airport on 26 february 2014 after arriving on a flight from sao paulo , via amsterdam .
during a search of her bags border force officers found 50 containers of face cream , talcum powder and other toiletries .
inside there was 7.8 kilos of high purity cocaine .
messages found on mccreath 's mobile phone showed she was due to take a train to manchester from glasgow , where she would hand the drugs over .
she was found guilty of importing class a drugs following a trial at glasgow high court in october .
on wednesday 2 december she was sentenced to seven years in prison .

documents.title: scottish government to ban councils from cutting the primary school week to save money
text: councils are to be banned from cutting the length of the primary school week to save money .
the scottish government is to change the law to make sure children spend a minimum of 25 hours a week in class .
this follows rows over attempts by some councils to reduce the length of the school week to help balance their books .
the eis teachers union has welcomed the move but local government organisation cosla is angry .
the government says primary school children will be guaranteed at least 950 hours a year of teaching time , equivalent to 25 hours a week .
ministers have decided to amend the education bill , which is currently before parliament , to do this .

documents.title: lord advocate handed police watchdog report into m9 crash deaths of lamara bell and john yuill
text: a police watchdog report into the deaths of a couple who lay undiscovered in their crashed car for three days has been handed to the lord advocate .
lamara bell , 25 , was critically ill when she was found in the car on the m9 near stirling on 8 july .
her dead partner john yuill , 28 , was found next to her .
an investigation was ordered after it was revealed a witness had phoned police on the day of the crash to say he had seen the couple 's renault clio come off the road .
however , the call was not logged and emergency services did not look for the couple until three days later .

scotland 's most senior prosecutor , frank mulholland , ordered the police investigations and review commissioner ( pirc ) to launch a probe and the watchdog has now handed its interim findings over to the crown

a spokesman for pirc said : `` the commissioner has submitted an interim report to the lord advocate on her independent investigation into the circumstances surrounding the deaths of john yuill , 28 , and lamara bell , 25 , following the recovery of a car close to the motorway at bannockburn on 8 july 2015 .
`` the lord advocate will now consider the interim report and the commissioner will undertake further enquiries as required . ''

documents.title: golden eagle owner loses bird after it flies off during holiday in aberdeenshire
text: a wildlife enthusiast has been left distraught after his young golden eagle flew off while he was on holiday in aberdeenshire .
les gibson , from county durham , was flying odin on the glen muick estate when they became separated last week .
he has been back to search for the bird of prey , but without success.mr gibson hopes the public can come to his aid.mr gibson hopes odin will be hunting and killing to survive .
he told bbc scotland : `` i had been flying him all week on the hills .
he would normally go off for a good distance and come back , but he just kept going .

documents.title: scots scientists set to see gravity wave experiment blast off into space
text: scientists at the university of glasgow hope an experiment they 've designed to detect gravitational waves will finally get into space tomorrow .
the team are working on efforts to find ripples in space time - a key part of einstein 's theory of relativity .
the instruments were meant to be put into orbit this morning , but a problem with the european space agency 's vega rocket has resulted in lift off being postponed .

documents.title: engineers and specialists begin detailed inspection of the forth road bridgeupdate
text: there 's been widespread disruption on all routes to the forth road bridge this morning after the southbound carriageway was closed because of concerns over some steel joints .
a contraflow system is operating on the northbound lane .
engineering have begun a planned inspection of the bridge to determine the extent of the problem .
drivers are being warned that the carriageway closure could continue through and beyond this evening 's rush hour .

documents.title: teenage gang member sexually assaults woman at west lothian railway station
text: police are appealing for information after a woman was sexually assaulted at uphall railway station in west lothian on saturday , 28 november .

the 45-year-old victim was boarding the 06.54 service to edinburgh waverley when she was grabbed by one of a group of youths who got on the train at the same time.. officers are reviewing cctv from the train and the station in an attempt to identify the person responsible .

he is described as being aged between 15 and 18 , slim , with brown hair and wearing a blue t-shirt.. detective constable paul farquhar of british transport police said : this assault left the victim upset and i am hopeful that anyone who was at the station or on the train and has information which can identify those involved will feel able to get in touch . documents.title: jewellery thieves hunted after they target dumfries home in broad daylight
text: police are appealing for information after jewellery thieves targeted a dumfries home in `` broad daylight '' .
goods including diamond rings and a pendant were taken from the house in troqueer road some time between 08:00 and 17:00 on tuesday .
the total value of the items taken has been estimated at about £ 5,000 .
pc alison burke appealed for anyone who saw anything sus in the area at the time of the theft to contact them .

documents.title: quarter of families 'unable to cope ' with elderly relatives in hospital , says charity
text: nearly a quarter of families are unable to look after older relatives when they leave hospital , according to a survey for the royal voluntary service .
the charity says health and social services are under severe pressure .
they have urged communities and councils to work more closely with hospitals to help struggling families organise care .

text: also coming up today at hoyrood - angela constance is in the hot seat in this week 's portfolio questions , alongside her junior education ministers .
the scottish conservatives will later lead a debate attacking the scottish government 's named person policy for children .
snp msp bob doris will then lead a member 's debate commending the employees of city building and rsbi .

documents.title: free church moderator says bombing syria would be a 'personal ego trip ' by cameronupdate
text: the moderator of the free church of scotland has said britain should not be bombing syria because prime minister david cameron has not made a strong enough case for such

rev david robertson said that bombing was being presented by the uk government as a first response rather than a last resort '' , adding that it seemed to be more about preserving britain 's place in the world pecking order '' .
mr robertson said : britain dropping a few more bombs on syria is not really about defeating isis .
it is about britain 's reputation .
as the prime minister egotistically observed 'the world is looking at us ' .
a war is not 'just ' because it is waged in order to show that a nation still has it , or as a personal ego trip for political leaders . ''

documents.title: rangers manager mark warburton is identified by fulham as their potential new boss
text: fulham have identified rangers boss mark warburton as a serious candidate to succeed kit symons as manager .
sport understands that warburton will now be actively pursued by the english championship side , who sacked symons last month .
warburton refused to be drawn on the speculation , saying : `` we 're into a long-term project at rangers and we 're in a good place right now . ''
there has been no official contact between fulham and rangers yet .
fulham have turned their attention to warburton after missing out on reading manager steve clarke and birmingham city boss gary rowett .

text: anthony stokes has been suspended by celtic for two weeks following his social media comments about being left out of the team .
the striker , 27 , apologised on twitter after two posts on sunday expressing his frustration .
stokes complained about sitting in the stand at inverness and insisted playing was more important than money .
manager ronny deila said that stokes ' remarks `` showed a lack of respect '' to his team-mates .

documents.title: salmond calls cameron 's 'terrorist sympathisers ' remark sign of 'desperation'update
text: mps will vote tonight on whether to step up military operations against islamic state militants by extending air strikes from iraq to syria .
david cameron appears to be on course for a clear majority , with the help of labour and liberal democrat votes .
but last night , he was condemned for telling conservative rebels they should not vote with jeremy corbyn and what he called `` a bunch of terrorist sympathisers . ''
snp mps are also set to vote against air strikes .
alex salmond told the bbc 's good morning scotland programme that mr cameron 's remarks were `` a sign of desperation '' .

as you start to examine the case - as the foreign affairs select committee did yesterday - then some of the prime minister 's claims start to disintegrate like dust , like the claim , for example , that there are 70,000 ground troops which are going to step into the vacuum which will be released if daesh is forced to concede ground in syria .
it 's just not true - it 's not credible .
and as these claims start to distintegrate then the support for this action starts to ebb away

documents.title: probe finds fisherman swept overboard died because crew did n't know how to rescue him
text: an investigation has found that a man swept overboard from a fishing boat in rough seas off shetland died because the crew did n't know how to rescue him .
joshua aryeetey was working on the trawler beryl in february when the accident happened .
safety advice has since been issued to the fishing industry , and recommendations made to improve practical safety training .

documents.title: vast majority of scottish mps poised to vote against airstrikes in syria
text: a house of commons debate and vote on whether or not the uk should launch airstrikes against so-called islamic state targets in syria is due to get under way this morning .
the commons timetable has been cleared to allow members ten and a half hours to discuss the extension of military action .
conservative ministers are confident that labour mps will support the airstrikes , but the snp will vote against them .
it means the overwhelming majority of scottish mps are opposed to the plans .

text: engineers are due on site at the forth road bridge to inspect a potential defect found in the structure 's steel work last night .
it comes after inspectors closed the southbound carriageway of the bridge after discovering the damage .
motorists have been advised to avoid the bridge if possible .
a contraflow is currently operating on the other carriageway .
